body_html:
In the example ptb_word_lm.py, line 257

  state = m.initial_state.eval()
  for step, (x, y) in enumerate(reader.ptb_iterator(data, m.batch_size,
                                                    m.num_steps)):
    cost, state, _ = session.run([m.cost, m.final_state, eval_op],
                                 {m.input_data: x,
                                  m.targets: y,
                                  m.initial_state: state})

However, there is no placeholder for m.ititial_state. Why this could work?

body:
In the example [ptb_word_lm.py](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb/ptb_word_lm.py), line 257

```
  state = m.initial_state.eval()
  for step, (x, y) in enumerate(reader.ptb_iterator(data, m.batch_size,
                                                    m.num_steps)):
    cost, state, _ = session.run([m.cost, m.final_state, eval_op],
                                 {m.input_data: x,
                                  m.targets: y,
                                  m.initial_state: state})
```

However, there is no placeholder for `m.ititial_state`. Why this could work?
